page.title: 05BEESLACK HIGH SCHOOL
page.content: Beeslack High School is on the outskirts of Penicuik and is built in the grounds of Beeslack House.It was opened on the 15th August 1984. A new high school was needed because Penicuik High was overcrowded. The primary schools that feed into it are, Mauricewood, Ladywood, Glencorse, Bilston and Roslin. It is a beautiful school with facilities like a swimming pool, a games hall and 2 football and 1 rugby pitch. The school is surrounded by trees and large grassy areas. At the present time there are 454 pupils, although the school is built to take a larger number. There are 17 teachers and eighteen different subjects which can be taught. Presently only 1st to 3rd year pupils attend the school but it will eventually become a full 6 year secondary school.
